pr_title: [DB TimeLock] 1B, 1C: DB TimeLock for Multiple Series

timeline.author: sudiksha27

timeline.bodyText: nit: this is not being used anymore?
timeline.author: sudiksha27

replies.bodyText: Doh! Yeah, this went away since I extracted this before factoring out the createTimestampTable() stuff. Removed
replies.author: jeremyk-91

timeline.author: sudiksha27

timeline.bodyText: I see we're removing the option of providing tablePrefix for multi series, which should be fine. Maybe we should should use Client rather than String for type checking?
timeline.author: sudiksha27

replies.bodyText: Ah. We can't use Client, because that's a part of leader-election-api and this is in atlasdb-dbkvs. However, I agree that having a string wrapper type is a good suggestion, I'll add one.
replies.author: jeremyk-91

timeline.author: sudiksha27

timeline.bodyText: Maybe add a comment that pg query to create table already accommodates this check?
timeline.author: sudiksha27

replies.bodyText: Alright, added a comment below this if-block. I think it makes sense actually, since it looks a bit like a bug at first that you don't throw the exception in that case.
replies.author: jeremyk-91

timeline.message: This is why type checking is important
